card.desc:
In will get registered on the first time you enter a room URL.

based on room’s “Open for Anyone” setting, and organization’s “allow registration” setting, the path you take is different.

1. Room is open for anyone
   regardless of the organization’s setting, you can get registered, but under no organization. you can enter any room that is “open for anyone”
2. Room is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is ON
   you can get registered under the organization.
   After getting registered, you may still get kicked out of the room if the room’s “Open for Anyone in the organization” is OFF.
   you’ll see “No room found” page if you get kicked out.
3. Room is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is OFF
   you’ll see “No Room Found” page.
card.name: Registration

old.desc:
In will get registered on the first time you enter an event URL.

based on event’s “Open for Anyone” setting, and organization’s “allow registration” setting, the path you take is different.

1. Event is open for anyone
   regardless of the organization’s setting, you can get registered, but under no organization. you can enter any room that is “open for anyone”
2. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is ON
   you can get registered under the organization.
   After getting registered, you may still get kicked out of the event if the event’s “Open for Anyone in the organization” is OFF.
   you’ll see “No event found” page if you get kicked out.
3. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is OFF
   you’ll see “No Event Found” page.

card.desc:
By clicking the screenshare button and choosing the window/tab/applicationtou want to share, will launch the screenshare.
The system will create a floating screen in the scene. It also creates a 2D view of the screen inside the "preview panel".
Please note that your own screen share will NOT be duplicates to your preview panel, but it is being shown for other users.

Multiple uses can share their screen simultaneously.
card.name: Start screenshare

old.desc:
By clicking the screenshare button and choosing the window/tab/applicationtou want to share, will launch the screenshare.
The system will create a floating screen in the scene. It also creates a 2D view of the screen inside the "preview panel".
Please note that your own screen share will NOT be duplicates to your preview panel, but it is being shown for other users.

card.desc:
You can see nenter's voice by selecting from available options. Availablity of each voice is browser dependent.

The setting can only be achieved by PC or Mac, machines, not from the mobile devices. but the voice setting work for all browsers.
some voices that are named with "microsoft..." won't work for Mac or iOS. in that case, the default voice will be used.
card.name: Managing AI mentors

old.desc: You can see nenter's voice by selecting from available options. Availablity of each voice is browser dependent.

card.desc: Rooms can be created as many as the organization wants.
card.name: Managing rooms

card.desc:
You can create a text card by clicking the create text card button t the bottom right of the screen.

Text card is essentially an image that floats in the 3D space, and it can contain title, description, and the link URL.
When user clicks the text card, the user will be sent to the external site.

Text card can contain multibyte texts such as Japanese and Chines. Aframe doesn't support the display of these multibyte characters, so it should be rendered into an image before it is appended to the scene.

You can also attach the text card as a caption to an image. The caption will be displayed below the original image, and it willove along with the image.

You can also choose to let an AI to generate the image that the caption will be attached.
card.name: Text card

You can also attach the text card as a caption to an image. The caption will be displayed below the original image, and it willove along with the image.

You can also choose to let an AI to generate the image itself that the caption will be attached.

card.desc:
When you turn ON the generate image button at the chat panel, the send button changes to generate image button.

When you type the prompt to the message box and click generate image button, it will send the prompt to AI.

after about 20-30 seconds, you will get a notification on the screen saying your image is ready, and the image is uploaded as a chat message from the AI mentor.

You can them send this generated image to the room by clicking send to room button.
card.name: Generate image using AI

card.desc:
When you add \@Mentor somewhere in the message, or by turning \@Mentor button ON, you can talk to the AI mentor.

AI mentor comes close to you when answering your question.

When there’s multipl users in the room, AI Mentor will always move close to the user that are talking to the AI. AI Mentor’s position is synced with other users, so there’s only one universal position for AI mentor to be.
card.name: Chat in the Room

card.desc:
Uploading a video into a scene will create a floating video item in the scene, and start the video automatically.

When entering the room that has a video inside from the beginning will NOT play the video automatically.

This is because we want to avoid all videos being played, with their audio ON, at once when there are multiple videos in the room.
card.name: Video upload

old.desc:
Uploading a video into a scene will create a floating video item in the scene, and start the video automatically.

When entering the room that has a video inside from the beginning will NOT play the video automatically.

This is because we want to avoid all videos being played at once when there are multiple videos in the room.

card.desc:
Uploading a video into a scene will create a floating video item in the scene, and start the video automatically.

When entering the room that has a video inside from the beginning will NOT play the video automatically.

This is because we want to avoid all videos being played at once when there are multiple videos in the room.
card.name: Video upload

card.desc:
If you add a link to URL for the image or video in the scene, users will have option to go to that list nk when clicking the item in the scene.

The link URL does not work when the item is unlocked (editing mode).
When item is locked, clicking on it once will show the text saying "Link to URL".
clicking the item one more time will take the user to the linked URL.
The "Link to URL" will disappear after a few seconds.

This is because of that fact that panning in the scene also requires a click from the user. And if the user is taken to external site just with one click, the user won't be able to navigate themselves in the room with a lot of link images. Especially when user is visiting the room with touch device, with small screen, the user certainly will click one of the linked items when they try to just look around. Thus, requiring a double tap for user in order to go to an external site is necessary.
card.name: Add link to an image or video
Add link to an image or video
Add link to an image or video

card.desc:
While selecting an object in the scene, you can click a "send to preview panel" button to copy the object into the preview panel.

Preview panel can be hidden/displayed by clicking the preview panel button at the bottom right corner of the screen. This button will not be seen if there's no item in the preview panel.

If you click the X button of the item in the preview panel, the item will be deleted from the panel, but not from the scene. Shared screen cannot be removed from the preview panel.
card.name: Preview panel

card.desc:
When image, video, or 3D objects are unlocked, you can mode them with your mouse.
Dragging them will move their position, but not rotate them.

If you press Control key while dragging, you can scale the object. Moving the mouse cursor right/left will change the size of the object.

If you press Shift key while dragging, it will change the rotation of the object. Moving the mouse right/left and also up/bottom will rotate the object.
card.name: Transporting object in 3D space

card.desc: Achieved through LangChain library

card.desc:
To upload an image to the scene, you’ll click the [+] icon at the bottom right.
Image can be locked /unlocked for you.
In order to unlock the image, you need to be the owner of the image, or you need to be a manager of the organization.
When unlocked, you can move the image around, rotate, and resize.
When unlocked, you can also edit the title , link URL.

you can also turn the image into a 360 sphere image.
card.name: Image upload

Users can choose to turn on the audio access upon entering room. Audio is set to "muted" by default.
Camera is also "disabled" at first.
card.name: Enabling Audio

old.desc: Users can choose to turn on the audio access upon entering room. Audio is set to "muted" by default.

card.desc:
Basic profile must be filled before entering.
Nickname: only alphabet and numbers are allowed. This is due to Aframe's limitation to display text inside the scene
Avatar: you can choose from preset avatars.

Optional fields are
First Name
Last Name
card.name: Basic profile

card.desc:
Upon entering a room, you SHOULD be registered to the system. But not necessarily to one or multiple organizations.
If not logged in, you will be promoted to enter an email and verification code.
card.name: Login

card.desc:
In will get registered on the first time you enter an event URL.

based on event’s “Open for Anyone” setting, and organization’s “allow registration” setting, the path you take is different.

1. Event is open for anyone
   regardless of the organization’s setting, you can get registered, but under no organization. you can enter any room that is “open for anyone”
2. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is ON
   you can get registered under the organization.
   After getting registered, you may still get kicked out of the event if the event’s “Open for Anyone in the organization” is OFF.
   you’ll see “No event found” page if you get kicked out.
3. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is OFF
   you’ll see “No Event Found” page.
card.name: Registration

old.desc:
In will get registered on the first time you enter an event URL.

based on event’s “Open for Anyone” setting, and organization’s “allow registration” setting, the path you take is different.

3. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is OFF
   you’ll see “No Event Found” page.

card.desc:
In will get registered on the first time you enter an event URL.

based on event’s “Open for Anyone” setting, and organization’s “allow registration” setting, the path you take is different.

1. Event is open for anyone
   regardless of the organization’s setting, you can get registered, but under no organization. you can enter any room that is “open for anyone”
2. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is ON
   you can get registered under the organization.
3. Event is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is OFF
   you’ll see “No Event Found” page.
card.name: Registration

old.desc:
In order to get registered as a user,

1. You may visit any of the “Open for anyone” event created under any organization.
2. The organization’s “Allow Registration” must be switched ON.
3. The organization’s managers have the privilege to create a user under the organization.

In the case of 1), you’ll get registered under no organization. You can still access any event that is “Open for Anyone”.

If it is the case for 2), users can visit one of the organization's event URL.
Then, by entering the email and the verification that is sent to the email address, you get registered in that organization without manager privilege.

If you are already registered to one organization, and still visit the event URL of another organization, you get vetted the same manner. If the organization’s allow registration option is turned ON, then you can automatically enter the event, and also get registered under the organization.

In any cases, if the organization’s allow registration is turned OFF, you’ll see “No Event Found” page.

Registration can only be done under a specific organization. You can’t just create an account without belonging to any of the organization.

In any cases, if the organization’s allow registration is turned OFF, you’ll see “No Event Found” page.

Registration can only be done under a specific organization. You can’t just create an account without belonging to any of the organization.

card.desc: This card is about social media management of Blanc Chef
card.name: Social Media

cards.desc:
Currently you can't go into the room unless you belong to the organization, or the room should be set to public.
It will be better if we can issue a lot nk to allow user to get registered and get registered as a member of the organization at the same time.
cards.name: Organization specific login URL

cards.desc:
In will get registered on the first time you enter a room URL.

based on room’s “Open for Anyone” setting, and organization’s “allow registration” setting, the path you take is different.

1. Room is open for anyone
   regardless of the organization’s setting, you can get registered, but under no organization. you can enter any room that is “open for anyone”
2. Room is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is ON
   you can get registered under the organization.
   After getting registered, you may still get kicked out of the room if the room’s “Open for Anyone in the organization” is OFF.
   you’ll see “No room found” page if you get kicked out.
3. Room is NOT open for anyone, Organization’s allow register is OFF
   you’ll see “No Room Found” page.
cards.name: Registration

cards.desc:
Upon entering a room, you SHOULD be registered to the system. But not necessarily to one or multiple organizations.
If not logged in, you will be promoted to enter an email and verification code.
cards.name: Login

cards.desc:
Basic profile must be filled before entering.
Nickname: only alphabet and numbers are allowed. This is due to Aframe's limitation to display text inside the scene
Avatar: you can choose from preset avatars.

Optional fields are
First Name
Last Name
cards.name: Basic profile

cards.desc:
Users can choose to turn on the audio access upon entering room. Audio is set to "muted" by default.
Camera is also "disabled" at first.
cards.name: Enabling Audio

cards.desc: Turning audio ON will enable your microphone. The browser may ask users for the permission depending on the browser setting.
cards.name: Audio

cards.desc: Turning camera ON will start the camera and display the video in front of your avatar face so other users can see your face. Your own camera preview will be displayed at the bottom right corner of your screen.
cards.name: Camera

cards.desc: This card is about social media management of Blanc Chef
cards.name: Social Media

cards.desc:
By clicking the screenshare button and choosing the window/tab/applicationtou want to share, will launch the screenshare.
The system will create a floating screen in the scene. It also creates a 2D view of the screen inside the "preview panel".
Please note that your own screen share will NOT be duplicates to your preview panel, but it is being shown for other users.

Multiple uses can share their screen simultaneously.
cards.name: Start screenshare

cards.desc:
To upload an image to the scene, you’ll click the [+] icon at the bottom right.
Image can be locked /unlocked for you.
In order to unlock the image, you need to be the owner of the image, or you need to be a manager of the organization.
When unlocked, you can move the image around, rotate, and resize.
When unlocked, you can also edit the title , link URL.

you can also turn the image into a 360 sphere image.
cards.name: Image upload

cards.desc:
Uploading a video into a scene will create a floating video item in the scene, and start the video automatically.

When entering the room that has a video inside from the beginning will NOT play the video automatically.

This is because we want to avoid all videos being played, with their audio ON, at once when there are multiple videos in the room.
cards.name: Video upload

cards.desc:
When image, video, or 3D objects are unlocked, you can mode them with your mouse.
Dragging them will move their position, but not rotate them.

If you press Control key while dragging, you can scale the object. Moving the mouse cursor right/left will change the size of the object.

If you press Shift key while dragging, it will change the rotation of the object. Moving the mouse right/left and also up/bottom will rotate the object.
cards.name: Transporting object in 3D space

cards.desc:
While selecting an object in the scene, you can click a "send to preview panel" button to copy the object into the preview panel.

Preview panel can be hidden/displayed by clicking the preview panel button at the bottom right corner of the screen. This button will not be seen if there's no item in the preview panel.

If you click the X button of the item in the preview panel, the item will be deleted from the panel, but not from the scene. Shared screen cannot be removed from the preview panel.
cards.name: Preview panel

cards.desc:
If you add a link to URL for the image or video in the scene, users will have option to go to that list nk when clicking the item in the scene.

The link URL does not work when the item is unlocked (editing mode).
When item is locked, clicking on it once will show the text saying "Link to URL".
clicking the item one more time will take the user to the linked URL.
The "Link to URL" will disappear after a few seconds.

This is because of that fact that panning in the scene also requires a click from the user. And if the user is taken to external site just with one click, the user won't be able to navigate themselves in the room with a lot of link images. Especially when user is visiting the room with touch device, with small screen, the user certainly will click one of the linked items when they try to just look around. Thus, requiring a double tap for user in order to go to an external site is necessary.
cards.name: Add link to an image or video

cards.desc:
You can add description to any images, video, or 3d models in the room.
If there is a description, and if any user stands near an object long enough, AI mentor will come to the user and start explaining about the object, referencing the description.
cards.name: Add description to the image or video

cards.desc:
You can create a text card by clicking the create text card button t the bottom right of the screen.

Text card is essentially an image that floats in the 3D space, and it can contain title, description, and the link URL.
When user clicks the text card, the user will be sent to the external site.

Text card can contain multibyte texts such as Japanese and Chines. Aframe doesn't support the display of these multibyte characters, so it should be rendered into an image before it is appended to the scene.

You can also attach the text card as a caption to an image. The caption will be displayed below the original image, and it willove along with the image.

You can also choose to let an AI to generate the image that the caption will be attached.
cards.name: Text card

cards.desc:
You can attach an event to the text card.
If the event is attached, the text card will also display the date and time of the event.
cards.name: Text card with event

cards.desc:
When you add \@Mentor somewhere in the message, or by turning \@Mentor button ON, you can talk to the AI mentor.

AI mentor comes close to you when answering your question.

When there’s multipl users in the room, AI Mentor will always move close to the user that are talking to the AI. AI Mentor’s position is synced with other users, so there’s only one universal position for AI mentor to be.
cards.name: Chat with AI mentor

cards.desc:
When you turn ON the generate image button at the chat panel, the send button changes to generate image button.

When you type the prompt to the message box and click generate image button, it will send the prompt to AI.

after about 20-30 seconds, you will get a notification on the screen saying your image is ready, and the image is uploaded as a chat message from the AI mentor.

You can them send this generated image to the room by clicking send to room button.
cards.name: Generate image using AI

cards.desc:
When you turn ON the talk to mentor button, your microphone will be activated to start capturing your voice.
Then you can naturally talk to the mentor.
Any message you create with talk to mentor button will automatically be sent to AI mentor.
cards.name: Talk to the AI mentor

cards.desc:
Not turning on either of the AI mentor button and Generate image button, you can send a generic text chat to the chat messages.
All the messages will be gone if everyone in the room leave the room. If you want to keep certain messages to the chatbox so you can see them when you come back, click the link button.
cards.name: Chat with the team

cards.desc: You can upload any types of files in the chat to share among the members in the room. You can simply click the attachment button.
cards.name: Upload files to the chat

cards.desc:
By visiting the dashboard of the organization, you have option to chat with particular AI mentor.

By clicking one of the available AI mentors to chat, you will be sent to the chatroom.

Here, you can have conversation with the AI mentor.
Chat history is saved for each users, and will not be shared with other users.
cards.name: 1 on 1 chat with AI mentor

cards.desc:
By default, AI will read the response it makes to the user.
You can silince AI by turning AI speaks button OFF.
cards.name: AI speaking mode

cards.desc:
Managers of each organization should have an interface to see the list of the users and events of that organization.
This can be accessed by
https://virtuaCampus.com/slug-of-organization/manager

Here you can see the access logs, manage users, rooms, AI mentors, and events.
cards.name: Manager console

cards.desc:
You can see nenter's voice by selecting from available options. Availablity of each voice is browser dependent.

The setting can only be achieved by PC or Mac, machines, not from the mobile devices. but the voice setting work for all browsers.
some voices that are named with "microsoft..." won't work for Mac or iOS. in that case, the default voice will be used.
cards.name: Managing AI mentors

cards.desc: Rooms can be created as many as the organization wants.
cards.name: Managing rooms

MySQL server
Located in the US north east region.

Using common data for both developing and production 

Daily backups in action
cards.name: Database @AWS Lightsail instance

cards.desc:
Sveltekit project
with Vite compiler

Typescript 100%
Strictly use Typescript, don't use :any

Application is being run by pm2

All updates saved in github

Deployment:
sh deploy.sh
Will do the following
git pull
npm I
npm run build
pm2 restart 1(no npm start required)
cards.name: Application

cards.desc: Version 1.4
cards.name: AFRAME

cards.desc:
Provided by Twilio Video
Not only audio and videos, but also positions, rotations of all objects are communicated through data channel for realtime communication.
cards.name: Video/audio/data transaction

cards.desc: File upload picker and storage is provided through Filestack.
cards.name: File Storage @Filestack

cards.desc: Emails sender
cards.name: Emails via Sendgrid

`sudo /opt/bitnami/bncert-tool`

provided via Let’s encrypt

vhost conf files

sudo /opt/bitnami/ctlscript.sh restart apache
cards.name: SSL

cards.name: ChatGPT @ openAI

it is private!!!

cards.desc:
sh [deploy.sh](http://deploy.sh "‌")

will do

```shell
git pull
npm install
npm run build
pm2 restart "dev" // "production" for production environment
```

```shell
pm2 list // list the process
```
cards.name: Deploy
